info.title: System API
info.description: The `System` plugin is used to manage various system-level features such as power settings and firmware updates.

friendlyName.summary: The friendly name of the device which used to display on the client device list

seconds.summary: The deep sleep timeout in seconds

userAgent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; x86_64 GNU/Linux) AppleWebKit/601.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/8.0 Safari/601.1 WPE

cacheContains.summary: Checks if a key is present in the cache.

clearLastDeepSleepReason.summary: Clears the last deep sleep reason.

deletePersistentPath.summary: Deletes persistent path associated with a callsign.

callsign.description: Callsign of the service to delete persistent path

type.description: The type of execution environment. (can be used instead of callsign)

enableMoca.summary: Enables (or disables) Moca support for the platform.

value.summary: `true` to enable Moca support or `false` to disable Moca support.

enableXREConnectionRetention.summary: Enables (or disables) XRE Connection Retention option.

enable.summary: `true` to enable XRE connection retention or `false` to disable.

fireFirmwarePendingReboot.summary: Notifies the device about a pending reboot.

events.onFirmwarePendingReboot: Triggers when the firmware has a pending reboot

getCachedValue.summary: Gets the value of a key in the cache.

sampleKey.summary: Value for the specified key name

getCoreTemperature.summary: Returns the core temperature of the device. Not supported on all devices.

getDeviceInfo.summary:
Collects device details. Sample keys include:  
* bluetooth_mac  
* boxIP  
* build_type  
* estb_mac  
* imageVersion  
* rf4ce_mac  
* wifi_mac.

params.summary: A list of supported device keys

estb_mac.summary: Value for the specified key name

downloadedFWLocation.summary: The location of the downloaded firmware

isRebootDeferred.summary: Whether the device should be rebooted

events.onFirmwareUpdateInfoReceived: Triggers when the firmware update information is requested

getFirmwareUpdateState.summary: Checks the state of the firmware update.

getLastDeepSleepReason.summary: Retrieves the last deep sleep reason.

getLastFirmwareFailureReason.summary: Retrieves the last firmware failure reason.

failReason.example: Image Download Failed - Unable to connect

getMacAddresses.summary: Gets the MAC address of the device.

events.onMacAddressesRetreived: Triggers when the MAC addresses are requested

items.example: 2020 Jan 28 08:24:06.762355 arrisxi6 systemd[1]: Starting Log RDK Started Service...

getMode.summary: Returns the currently set mode information.

getNetworkStandbyMode.summary: Returns the network standby mode of the device. If network standby is `true`, the device supports `WakeOnLAN` and `WakeOnWLAN` actions in STR (S3) mode.

getOvertempGraceInterval.summary: Returns the over-temperature grace interval value. Not supported on all devices.

getPlatformConfiguration.summary: Returns the supported features and device/account info.

query.description: Query for support of a particular feature, e.g. AccountInfo.accountId

getPowerState.summary: Returns the power state of the device.

getPowerStateBeforeReboot.summary: Returns the power state before reboot.

getPowerStateIsManagedByDevice.summary: Checks whether the power state is managed by the device.

powerStateManagedByDevice.summary: `true` if power state is managed by the device, `false` otherwise

getPreferredStandbyMode.summary: Returns the preferred standby mode. This method returns an empty string if the preferred mode has not been set.

getPreviousRebootInfo.summary: Returns basic information about a reboot.

getPreviousRebootInfo2.summary: Returns detailed information about a reboot.

lastHardPowerReset.summary: The timestamp of the last hard power reset

getRFCConfig.summary: Returns information that is related to RDK Feature Control (RFC) configurations.

rfcList.summary: A list of RFC properties to query

RFCConfig.summary: A list of specified RFC properties

getStateInfo.summary: Queries device state information of various properties.

param.summary: The property to query as a string

getStoreDemoLink.summary: Returns the store demo video link.

fileURL.summary: The file URL of stored demo video

getTemperatureThresholds.summary: Returns temperature threshold values. Not supported on all devices.

getFriendlyName.summary: Returns the friendly name set by setFriendlyName API or default value.

getTerritory.summary: Gets the configured system territory and region. Territory is a ISO-3166-1 alpha-3 standard (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1). Region is a ISO-3166-2 alpha-2 standard (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

getTimeZones.summary: (Version2) Gets the available timezones from the system's time zone database. This method is useful for determining time offsets per zone.

getTimeZoneDST.summary: Get the configured time zone from the file referenced by `TZ_FILE`. If the time zone is not set, then `null` is returned.

getWakeupReason.summary: Returns the reason for the device coming out of deep sleep.

getXconfParams.summary: Returns XCONF configuration parameters for the device.

eStbMac.summary: The embedded set-top box MAC address

hasRebootBeenRequested.summary: Checks whether a reboot has been requested.

rebootRequested.summary: `true` if a reboot has been requested, otherwise `false`

reboot.summary: Requests that the system performs a reboot of the set-top box.

events.onRebootRequest: Triggers when a device reboot request is made

systemUptime.summary: The uptime, in seconds, of the device

setBootLoaderPattern.summary: Sets the boot loader pattern mode in MFR.

setCachedValue.summary: Sets the value for a key in the cache.

setDeepSleepTimer.summary: Sets the deep sleep timeout period.

setFirmwareAutoReboot.summary: Enables or disables the AutoReboot Feature. This method internally sets the tr181 `AutoReboot.Enable` parameter to `true` or `false`.

enable.summary: `true` to enable Autoreboot or `false` to disable

setMode.summary:
Sets the mode of the set-top box for a specific duration before returning to normal mode. Valid modes are:  
* `NORMAL` - The set-top box is operating in normal mode.  
* `EAS` - The set-top box is operating in Emergency Alert System (EAS) mode. This mode is set when the device needs to perform certain tasks when entering EAS mode, such as setting the clock display or preventing the user from using the diagnostics menu.  
* `WAREHOUSE` - The set-top box is operating in warehouse mode.

events.onSystemModeChanged: Triggers when the system mode is changed successfully

setNetworkStandbyMode.summary: Enables or disables the network standby mode of the device. If network standby is enabled, the device supports `WakeOnLAN` and `WakeOnWLAN` actions in STR (S3) mode.

setOvertempGraceInterval.summary: Sets the over-temperature grace interval value. Not supported on all devices.

setPowerState.summary: Sets the power state of the device.

events.onSystemPowerStateChanged: Triggers when the system power state changes

standbyReason.summary: The reason for a standby state

setPreferredStandbyMode.summary: Sets and persists the preferred standby mode. See [getAvailableStandbyModes](#getAvailableStandbyModes) for valid modes. Invoking this function does not change the power state of the device. It only sets the user preference for the preferred action when the [setPowerState](#setPowerState) method is invoked with a value of `STANDBY`.

setTemperatureThresholds.summary: Sets the temperature threshold values. Not supported on all devices.

setFriendlyName.summary: Sets the friendly name of device. It allows an applications to set friendly name value which could be used by different applications to list this device on client mobile application. The provided name should not be empty. Friendly name is persisted on device and reuse after each reboot until updated by the user

setTerritory.summary: Sets the system territory and region.Territory is a ISO-3166-1 alpha-3 standard (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1). Region is a ISO-3166-2 alpha-2 standard (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

setTimeZoneDST.summary: Sets the system time zone. See `getTimeZones` to get a list of available timezones on the system.

events.onTimeZoneDSTChanged: Triggered when device time zone changed

updateFirmware.summary: Initiates a firmware update. This method has no affect if an update is not available.

uploadLogs.summary: Uploads logs to a URL returned by SSR.

uploadLogsAsync.summary: Starts background process to upload logs

events.onLogUpload: Triggered when logs upload process is done

abortLogUpload.summary: Stops background process to upload logs

events.onLogUpload: Triggered when logs upload process is stopped

onFirmwarePendingReboot.summary: Triggered when the `fireFirmwarePendingReboot` method is invoked

onFirmwareUpdateInfoReceived.summary:
Triggered when the `getFirmwareUpdateInfo` asynchronous method is invoked.  
Update details are:  
* `0` - A new firmware version is available.  
* `1` - The firmware version is at the current version.  
* `2` - XCONF did not return a firmware version (timeout or other XCONF error).  
* `3` - The device is configured not to update the firmware (`swupdate.conf` exists on the device)

rebootImmediately.summary: The value `true` indicates that the device has to be rebooted immediately or `false` otherwise

updateAvailable.summary: The value `false` indicates that there is no update available, either because there was no firmware update version returned from XCONF, or because the version returned from XCONF matches the version already on the device. The value of `true` indicates there is a firmware version available for update.

onFirmwareUpdateStateChange.summary:
Triggered when the state of a firmware update changes.  
State details are:  
* `0`: Uninitialized - there is no firmware update in progress  
* `1`: Requesting - requesting firmware update information  
* `2`: Downloading  
* `3`: Failed  
* `4`: Download Complete  
* `5`: Validation Complete  
* `6`: Preparing to Reboot

onMacAddressesRetreived.summary: Triggered when the `getMacAddresses` asynchronous method is invoked

ecm_mac.summary: The embedded cable modem MAC address

estb_mac.summary: The embedded set-top box MAC address

info.summary: Additional information (only if any of the above data is missing)
info.example: Details fetch: all are not success

onNetworkStandbyModeChanged.summary: Triggered when the network standby mode setting changes

onRebootRequest.summary: Triggered when an application invokes the reboot method

onSystemClockSet.summary: Triggered when the clock on the set-top device is updated

onSystemModeChanged.summary: Triggered when the device operating mode changes

onSystemPowerStateChanged.summary: Triggered when the power manager detects a device power state change

onFriendlyNameChanged.summary: Triggered when the device friendly name change

onTemperatureThresholdChanged.summary: Triggered when the device temperature changes beyond the `WARN` or `MAX` limits (see `setTemperatureThresholds`). Not supported on all devices.

exceeded.summary: Whether the threshold exceeded the configured value

onTerritoryChanged.summary: Triggered when the device territory changed

onTimeZoneDSTChanged.summary: Triggered when device time zone changed

onLogUpload.summary: Triggered when logs upload process is done or stopped
